intro: Cuspidaria monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf spurflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces a single, lance-shaped leaf that is often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
